result.execSummary:
The defendant Rianna Z Sturdivant was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
Defendant is not to possess any weapons.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Inform agent of all prescriptions.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

No association with any known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed. Maintain full time employment and/or school combination. Obtain a high school diploma. DNA Specimen waived due to date of violation. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: As a condition of probation, as directed by agent.

Plea/sentencing hearing at 11-23-2015 02:00 pm

Attorney Adam J. Schleis in court.   Defendant Rianna Z Sturdivant did not appear.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization. Defense requests a plea/sentencing date in 45 - 60 days. Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Hearing at 10-09-2015 11:00 am

Defendant Rianna Z Sturdivant in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for motion to suppress decision. Counsels have no more arguments. Standing issue addressed.  Court denies the motion. Defense requests another date. Court will give a date in three weeks.  Hearing scheduled for October 9, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Rianna Z Sturdivant in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State brings an issue before the Court before the motion hearing. Defense presents arguments. Court orders defense to file a supplemental response re: standing issue. Officer Christopher Harding sworn & testified. State rests. Defense rests. Testimony is closed.  State presents brief arguments. State may present briefing on the standing issue also. Defense presents arguments. Court will give another date in 30 days. Briefing by Defense to be filed by August 28, 2015. State to file anything by Sept. 4, 2015. Court may issue a written decision. Defendant's appearance is waived on the next date.  Decision scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
